[{'definition': ' (Νικάνωρ) Nicanor, '}, {'definition': ' a general under Antioch Epiphanes and Demetrius I, defeated and slain by Judah Maccabi (I Macc. VII, 39; II Macc. XV, 30). Y. Taan. II, 66ᵃ top (Meg. Taan. XII) יום נ׳ Nicanor-Day (a half-festival); Y. Meg. I, 70ᶜ bot.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' N., who imported Corinthian bronze doors for a Temple gate. Yoma III, 10; Tosef. ib. II, 4; Y. ib. III, 41ᵃ; Bab. ib. 38ᵃ. Midd. II, 3, a. fr. שער נ׳ (שערי), v. נְחוּשְׁתָּן', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Nero, the Roman emperor. Gitt. 56ᵃ נ׳ קיסר. Lam. R. to I, 5 מית נ׳ (Gitt. 56ᵇ קיסר).'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Pharaoh Necho (II), King of Egypt. Sot. 9ᵃ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': ' (prob. abbrev. of חנניה) Nannai, a name frequent in Maḥoza. Yeb. 115ᵇ bot., v. חֲבַי.'}]
[{'definition': ' (v. preced.) Siggaron (Guard), surname of the angel Gabriel. Snh. 44ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': 'Siddur, an Amora. Y. Ḥall. II, 58ᶜ top. Y. Sabb. VII, 9ᶜ top (ed. Krot. סירור).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Sihon, King of the Amorites. Ḥull. 60ᵇ; Gitt. 38ᵃ עמון זמואב טהרו בס׳ the districts of Ammon and Moab became permitted (a legitimate conquest) to the Israelites through Sihon (who had conquered them from Ammon and Moab, and from whom Israel took them by the right of conquest). B. Bath. 78ᵇ, v. סִיחָה; a. fr.—[Gen. R. s. 12 כפר סיחון (some ed. סיחין; oth. שיחין), v. שִׁיחִין.]'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. סִימַיי'}]

[{'definition': ' (Σίμων) Simon, name of several Amoraim. Y. Sabb. VIII, 11ᵃ bot.; Y. Shek. VIII, beg. 51ᵃ (also שִׁמְעוֹן). Y. Succ. IV, beg. 54ᵇ; a. fr.—Y. Pes. IX, beg. 36ᶜ. Y. Sabb. VII, 9ᵃ top; a. fr.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 118ᵃ.—Lam. R. to IV, 15; (Pesik. Vatt., p. 133ᵇ סימא).'}]

[{'definition': 'Simay, '}, {'definition': ' a Tannai. Kidd. 64ᵃ; Keth. 29ᵇ. Tosef. Sabb. XII (XIII), 14; Y. ib. XII, beg. 13ᶜ; a. e.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' an Amora. Ib. VII, 9ᶜ top. Y. Maas. Sh. II, 53ᵇ; Yeb. 74ᵃ סִמְיָא.—Pesik. Vattom. p. 134ᵃ ר׳ ס׳ בר קוסי (v. Bub. a. l. note 81); Yalk. Is. 333 ר׳ סימון.', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) (הר) ס׳ Mount Sinai. Sabb. 89ᵃ, v. סִימָנַאי. Shebu. 47ᵃ (expl. חזרה השבועה למקומה, ib. VII, 4) חזרה … לס׳ the oath (which ought to have been administered to one of the contestants) goes back to Sinai, i.e. the case is referred to Divine Justice that proclaimed from Sinai, ‘thou shalt not rob’, on which all Israelites are sworn. Ib. 22ᵇ, a. fr. מושבע ועומד מהר ס׳ הוא does he not stand sworn (not to eat it) from Mount Sinai? Macc. 22ᵃ לא קא חלה … מושבע ועומד מהר ס׳ הוא the oath (not to plough on the Holy Day) takes no effect, because he stands sworn &c. Ab. I, 1 משה קבל תורה מס׳ Moses received the Law from Sinai (by revelation); a. v. fr.—הלכה למשה מס׳, v. הֲלָכָה.—Sot. 21ᵃ דרשיה … כי ס׳ R. M. interpreted that verse (Cant. VIII, 7) like a revelation; Arakh. 30ᵇ.—Trnsf. erudite scholar. Hor. 14ᵃ, opp. to עוקר הרים (v. הַר) dialectician; Ber. 64ᵃ; M. Kat. 12ᵃ ס׳ אמר הלכה וכ׳ Sinai (R. Joseph) has said &c. (and you dare to differ?).'}]

[{'definition': 'Sisi, Sisay, name of several persons. Y. Maasr. I, 48ᵈ top ר׳ סיסיי.—Y. Yeb. XII, end, 13ᵃ לוי בר ס׳, v. לֵוִי; Gen. R. s. 81; Yalk. Prov. 964; Tanḥ. Tsav 5 סיסין; ed. Bub. 7 סיסון (corr. acc.).—Y. Sabb. VI, 7ᵈ bot. אינייני בר סיסיי (Naḥmanides: חנינא בר סיסי); Y. Snh. II, 20ᶜ bot. חנ׳ בר סיסי; Y. Ber. VI, 10ᶜ bot. חנ׳ בר סיסיי.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sisin. B. Bath. 30ᵃ; 159ᵇ (נכסי) דבי (בר) ס׳ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes) the estate of the family of (Bar) Sisin.—[Tanḥ. Tsav 5, v. סִיסִי.]'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Sisera, '}, {'definition': ' captain of the army of Jabin king of Canaan. Ber. 58ᵃ (ref. to I Chr. XXIX, 11, a. Jud. V, 20) זו מלחמת ס׳ this refers to the warfare against S.—Num. R. s. 9; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' name of a gentile gardener. Y. Dem. II, 22ᶜ bot.', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': 'Sisraṭai. Yalk. Ez. 340, v. סוּטַר.—Y. Kil. III, beg. 28ᶜ סיסרטא (corr. acc.). Y. Sabb. III, 5ᵈ top. Y. B. Mets. IV, 9ᵈ top; a. e.—Taan. 14ᵃ סִסְרָטַאי (Yoḥăsin סיטראטי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 200).'}]
[{'definition': ', אבא ס׳ Abba Siḳra (cmp. סִיקָרִין). Gitt. 56ᵃ, v. בַּרְיוֹנָא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sira; (בר) בן ס׳ Jesus son of Sira (Sirach), author of the Hebrew original of Ecclesiasticus. Snh. 100ᵇ. Gen. R. s. 73, end. Gen. R. s. 8; Y. Ḥag. II, 77ᶜ top בר סִירָה; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sikhna. Koh. R. to IV, 17 שמעון ס׳ (prob. to be read: סִכְנָאָה, v. סִכְנִין).'}]
[{'definition': 'Salla, name of an Amora. Ber. 29ᵇ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Beth Salluni (the family of Sallu). Gen. R. s. 63 חד מן אילין דב׳ ס׳ one of those of B. S. (Baʿal ʿAḳeda: לר׳ מאיר בבית סַלּוּא R. M. at Beth Sallu; Yalk. Gen. 110 את ר׳ גמליאל).'}]
[{'definition': 'Seleucus I, king of Syria. Midr. Till. to Ps. IX ed. Bub. סלייק׳ (oth. ed. סקילוס, corr. acc.); Yalk. Ps. 642 סולקוס, סיל׳ (corr. acc.), v. סְלִיקְיָא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Salmai. Taan. 28ᵃ (Ms. M. סמלאי); Tosef. ib. IV (III), 8; Y. ib. IV, 68ᵇ bot.; v. נְטוֹפָתִי.'}]

[{'definition': ' pr. n. m. Samma, name of several Amoraim (v. Yoḥăsin sub lit. ס) Ab. Zar. 50ᵇ; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' כְּפַר ס׳ pr. n. pl. K’far Samma, the home of one Jacob, a disciple of Jesus of Nazareth. Tosef.Ḥull. Ḥull. II, 22; Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40ᵈ bot.; a. e.; v., however, סִכְנַיָּא.', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': 'Sammael, name of an accuser and angel of death. Targ. Y. Gen. III, 6. Targ. Job XXVIII, 7 second vers.—Sot. 10ᵇ. Deut. R. s. 11 מלאך ס׳ הרשע ראש וכ׳ the angel S., the wicked, the chief of all Satans; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sammoḳa (dyer of red?), surname of R. Ṭayfa, v. טַיְיפָה.'}]
[{'definition': 'Abba Simmuḳyad (Red-hand). Num. R. s. 3.'}]
[{'definition': 'Simya, v. סִימַיי.'}]
[{'definition': 'S’malyon, a scholar. Sifré Deut. 357; Yalk. ib. 963; Sot. 13ᵇ ס׳ אמר וכ׳ S. says, (the voice called out,) And Moses died &c.'}]

[{'definition': 'S’naah. Taan. IV, 5 (26ᵃ) בני ס׳ (Ms. M. שִׁנְאָב; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Y. ib. IV, 68ᵇ bot.; Tosef. ib. IV (III), 6 ed. Zuck. (Var. סניאה); Bab. ib. 12ᵃ סִנְאָב (Ms. M. ש׳); Erub. 41ᵃ סנאב (Ms. O. סנאה).'}]
[{'definition': 'Sandalfon, name of an angel. Ḥag. 13ᵇ. Pesik. R. s. 20 אשו של ס׳ the fire of S.'}]

[{'definition': 'Bar-Sannigora. Targ. Y. I Num. XXXIV, 8 כרכוי דבר ס׳ the towns of Bar-S. (on the border between Syria and Palestine); [for טבריא ib., read with Y. II אנטוכיא]; Sifré Deut. 51 כרכא דבר סנגרא (not דבר); Yalk. ib. 874 (not כרבא); Tosef. Shebi. IV, 11 כפרא דבר סנגרא (read כרכא; Var. סינגורא); Y. Shebi. VI, 36ᶜ ברכה רבה ובר סנגדא (corr. acc., or כרכה רבה דבר ס׳ the large town of &c.).'}]
[{'definition': 'Sansan. Gen. R. s. 19 חנינא בר ס׳ (cmp. סִיסִי; Yalk. Esth. 1056 פפא).'}]
[{'definition': 'S’ʿorim, S’ʿoram. B. Mets. 73ᵇ רב סעורם; M. Kat. 28ᵃ רב שְׂעוֹרִים (Ms. M. סְעוֹרִים).'}]
[{'definition': 'Safra, an Amora. Pes. 52ᵇ. Ḥull. 110ᵇ; a. fr.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 119ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': 'Nissa, an Amora. Y. Erub. II, 20ᵃ bot. Y. B. Bath. II, beg. 13ᵇ. Y. Ter. XI, end, 48ᵇ; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (or נַצָּא) m. (preced.) strife; pr. n. m. Natsa. Sabb. 56ᵇ (transl. מריב, I Chr. VIII, 34, a. ref. to וירב, I Sam. XV, 5) נ׳ בר נ׳ Strife (Mephibosheth), son of Strife (Saul), v. נַחַל.'}]

[{'definition': 'Netsar, one of the alleged disciples of Jesus of Nazareth. Snh. 43ᵃ Ms. M. a. ed. Ven. (omitted in later edit., v. בּוּנִי).', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' בֶּן נ׳ Ben-Netsar (son of Nassor) name of a chief of robbers who became founder of a dynasty, i.e. Odenathus of Palmyra (v. Cyclop. Brit. s. v. Palmyra, Ersch u. Gruber II, Vol. 27, p. 185, Fürst Gloss., p. 145). Keth. 51ᵇ (opp. to מלכות אחשורוש the legitimate Persian dynasty). Gen. R. s. 76; Yalk. Dan. 1064 בן נָצוֹר. Y. Ter. VIII, 46ᵇ bot. בר ניצור.', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': 'Nacai (Lucas, v. Neub., v. Neub. Stud. Bibl. I, p. 61); נ׳ ספרא N. the scribe (or teacher). Gen. R. s. 79 שמע קליה דנ׳ ס׳ he heard N. say; Koh. R. to X, 8 קליה דינ׳ ס׳; Yalk. Gen. 133 דנקא׳; Pesik. B’shall., p. 90ᵃ דמינקי (corr. acc.).'}, {'definition': ' N., one of the disciples of Jesus of Nazareth. Snh. 43ᵃ Ms. M. a. early eds. (v. נֵצֶר IV).', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': 'Naḳdimon (Nicodemus) ben Gorion, a wealthy citizen of Jerusalem during the siege by Vespasian and Titus. Gitt. 56ᵃ. Taan. 20ᵃ (ed. Pes. נִיקוֹדִימוֹן); Ab. Zar. 25ᵃ; Yalk. Deut. 809; Yalk. Josh. 21. Gen. R. s. 42. Lam. R. to I, 16; Pesik. R. s. 29—30—30.'}]
[{'definition': 'Naḳosa. B. Kam. 81ᵇ יהודה בן נ׳ Ms. M. (ed. קנוסא); Y. Ber. II, end, 5ᵈ ed. Lehm. (ed. פפוס). Koh. R. to I, 8; VII, 26 (some ed. נקיסא).'}]

[{'definition': 'Nithza. Snh. 74ᵃ נמנו וגמרו בעליית בית נ׳ they voted and passed a law in the upper chamber of the house of N.; Y. ib. III, 21ᵇ top; Yalk. Deut. 838; Y. Shebi. IV, 35ᵃ bot. לבזה. Kidd. 40ᵇ; (Sifré Deut. 41 ערוד).'}]
[{'definition': ' (prob. to be read נִתְוָואר) pr. n. m. Erub. 59ᵃ (Ms. M. נִשְׁוָאר; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note; Ar. נתזור, prob. for נִתְוָור).'}]
[{'definition': 'N’thinah, father of Dama, (v. דָּמָא). Kidd. 31ᵃ; Y. ib. I, 61ᵇ top; a. e.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Nathan, '}, {'definition': ' the prophet. Koh. R. to IV, 12. Midr. Till. to Ps. LI; a. fr.—2) N. the Babylonian, a Tannai. Ber. IX, 5. Tosef. Yeb. VIII, 4. B. Bath. 73ᵃ; a. fr.—3) name of several Amoraim. Y. Erub. VI, 23ᶜ bot., v. דְּרוֹמָאָה; a. e.—Y. M. Kat. III, 82ᵃ נ׳ בר אבא.—Y. Ter. VII, 44ᶜ נ׳ בר הושעיה.—Y. Ber. IV, 7ᵇ נ׳ בר טובי; a. fr.—4) N. d’Tsutsitha, a penitent. Sabb. 56ᵇ.—אבות דר׳ נ׳, v. אָב II.', 'number': '1)'}]

[{'definition': ' pr. n. m. Saba. Y. Yeb. IX, beg. 10ᵃ ניחא בר ס׳; Y. Kil. IX, beg. 31ᵈ סָבָה.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' כְּפַר ס׳ pr. n. pl. K’far Saba, in Samaria. Y. Dem. II, 22ᶜ bot. (ed. Krot. כפרסבא, one word). Nidd. 61ᵃ; Tosef. ib. VIII, 5 (v. Hildesh. Beitr., p. 10).', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Sabṭa. Snh. 64ᵃ ס׳ בן אלס (v. אָלָס, a. אַבְלַס); Y. ib. X, 28ᵈ סובתה; Sifré Num. 131, a. Yalk. ib. 771 סבטיא.'}]

[{'definition': ', נְהַר ס׳ (Σαββατεῖον, Σαββατικός) the river Sabbation, said to rest on the seventh day (v. Plin. Hist. Nat. XXXI, 2; Jos. Bell. Jud. V, 5, 1; Neub. Géogr. p. 33). Snh. 65ᵇ נהר ס׳ יוכיח let the river S. prove (that the seventh day is the Sabbath); Yalk. Lev. 617 סנ׳; Gen. R. s. 11 סמ׳; Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 33 סמ׳; Pesik. R. s. 23 סמ׳. Gen. R. s. 73 עשרת … לפנים מנהר סמ׳ וכ׳ the ten tribes were exiled to within the confines of the river S., whereas Judah and Benjamin were scattered over all lands; Y. Snh. X, 29ᶜ bot. סנ׳; Targ. Y. Ex. XXXIV, 10 מן לגיו לנהר סמ׳.'}]

[{'definition': ' (Σεβαστή) Sebaste, built by Herod on the site of the old Samaria (Shomron)., built by Herod on the site of the old Samaria (Shomron). Num. R. s. 10 (ref. to Am. VI, 1) that means the ten tribes שהיו יושבים לבטח בס׳ (not שיושבים) who dwelt safely in S.; Tanḥ. Sh’mini 5 בסְבַסְטְיָא. Arakh. III, 2 (14ᵃ), v. חוֹלַת; Sifra B’ḥuck. Par. 4, ch. X סְוַוסְטִי; Tosef. Arakh. II, 8 ספוסטא (Var. ספימטא, corr. acc.).'}]
[{'definition': 'Suga. B. Bath. 90ᵇ Ms. M. (ed. פוגא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).'}]
[{'definition': 'Suṭar. Y. Ber. I, 2ᶜ top (for which Yalk. Ez. 340: סִיסַרְטַאי).'}]
[{'definition': 'Sumah. Num. R. s. 14 ס׳ בר כתבה.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sumkhos (Symmachos), a Tannai, pupil of R. Meïr. Erub. 13ᵇ. Ib. III, 1. B. Bath. 73ᵃ; a. fr.—(V. Fr. Darkhé, p. 198.)'}]
[{'definition': 'Suriel, name of an angel. Ber. 51ᵃ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 100).'}]
[{'definition': 'Surmaḳi (cmp. סומקי). Yoma 10ᵃ (Ms. M. סיר׳, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).'}]

[{'definition': ' (prob. of Greek origin, cmp. pr. n. Σταδιεύς) Saṭda; בן ס׳ son of S., surname of Jesus of Nazareth. Sabb. 104ᵇ; Tosef. ib. XI (XII), 15; Y. ib. XII, end, 13ᵈ והלא בן ס׳ לא הביא וכ׳ but did not Ben S. bring sorcery from Egypt only in this way (by making incisions in his flesh)? Y. Snh. VII, 25ᵈ top כך עשו לבן סוט׳ וכ׳ so they did to Ben S. in Lydda, when they made two scholars lie in wait for him &c.; Y. Yeb. XVI, 15ᵈ bot. Sabb. l. c. (in editions not controlled by censors, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) בעל ס׳ בועל וכ׳ her husband’s name was S., her lover’s, Pandera; (refuted and changed) אמו ס׳ וכ׳ his mother’s name was S. … סַֹטְֹיַת ד̇אֹ וכ׳ this one deserted her husband; Snh. 67ᵃ סָטַת דא וכ׳ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).'}]
[{'definition': 'Sarisa, surname of one Levi (on account of a simile drawn from a castrate which he used). Y. Sabb. III, 6ᵃ bot.; Y. Bets. II, 61ᶜ. Y. Gitt. VI, 48ᵃ bot. לוי פריסא (corr. acc.).'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Sethor, one of the twelve spies. Sot. 34ᵇ; Gen. R. s. 71; a. e.; v. סְתוֹרִים.—[Tosef. Men. IX, 14 סְתִירָה II.].'}]
[{'definition': 'Sithriel. Bekh. 57ᵇ'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Eber, a descendant of Shem, believed to have maintained schools (oracles) in connection with Shem. Gen. R. s. 63 (ref. to Gen. XXV, 22) למדרשו של שם וע׳ to the school of Shem and Eber. Gen. R. s. 37 נביא גדול היה ע׳ וכ׳ E. was a great prophet, for he gave names alluding to coming events. Ib. s. 42 (expl. העברי, Gen. XIV, 13) שהוא מבני בניו של ע׳ because he is a descendant of Eber; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': '‘Agul. Y. Yeb. VI, 7ᶜ bot. ר׳ חנינה בר ע׳, v. עֲטַל.'}]
[{'definition': '‘Adi. Ab. Zar. 33ᵃ; Men. 69ᵇ, v. טַיְיעָא.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Og, king of Bashan. Gen. R. s. 42 (ref. to Gen. XIV, 13) הוא ע׳ הוא פליט Og is the one that escaped; Tanḥ. Ḥuck. 25. Ber. 54ᵃ אבן … לזרוק ע׳ וכ׳ the stone which Og king of Bashan wanted to cast upon Israel. Ib.ᵇ, a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. עִוְיָא II'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Uzza, '}, {'definition': ' one of the brothers that accompanied the Ark to Gibeah. Sot. 35a; Num. R. s. 4. Num. R. s. 21; a. e.—2) name of a fallen angel. Yoma 67ᵇ מעשה ע׳ ועזאל the deed of U. and Azael (who came down and had connection with the daughters of man, v. Targ. Y. Gen. VI, 4). Pesik. R. s. 34 ומה עזא ועזאל וכ׳ when U. a. Azael … sinned on coming down &c. Deut. R. s. 11, end עזה ועזאל.—[Yalk. Gen. 44 שמחזי ועזאל; Targ. Y. Gen. VI, 4 שמחזי ועוזיאל.]', 'number': '1)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Uzziel, '}, {'definition': ' the father of Jonathan the translator. B. Bath. 133ᵇ, a. fr., v. יוֹנָתָן', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' name of two Amoraim. M. Kat. 5ᵃ ר׳ ע׳ בר בריה דר׳ ע׳ רבה R. U. grandson of R. U. the elder; Y. ib. I, 80ᵇ bot. ר׳ ע׳ בריה דר׳ חונייה. Y. Bets. III, 62ᵃ top; a. e.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 119ᵇ', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': ' name of a fallen angel, v. עֲזָאֵל, a. עוּזָּא II.', 'number': '—3)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Uzziah, king of Judah. M. Kat. 7ᵇ יותם לא היה לו לע׳ וכ׳ Jotham was begotten by U. after the latter was declared a leper; Tosef. Neg. VIII, 6. Gen. R. s. 20; Yalk. ib. 35. Num. R. s. 4 שעל ידו נצטרע ע׳ on account of it (the offering of frankincense) U. became a leper. Num. R. s. 7 זה ע׳ שבקש להכנס בתחום וכ׳ that is U. who attempted to encroach on the domain of priesthood; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': '‘Ivya, an Amora. B. Bath. 129ᵇ; 133ᵃ, sq. (Ms. M. עַוָּוא; Ms. R. עֲוִירָא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes).'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿĂvira, an Amora. Ḥull. 42ᵇ; 55ᵇ; a. fr.—V. עִוְיָא II.'}]

[{'definition': '‘Ula (or ‘Ulla), name of several Amoraim. Y. Shek. I, beg. 45ᵈ; a. fr.—Y. Ber. II, beg. 4ᵃ עילא.—Y. Meg. II, 73ᵇ עולה בירייה; Y. M. Kat. III, 83ᵇ bot. ע׳ ביריא; Bab. M. Kat. 26ᵃ ע׳ ביראה, v. בֵּירָאָה.—Y. Pes. III, 30ᵃ ע׳ דקיסרין; Y. Nidd. II, 50ᵃ bot.—Esp. known: ‘U. bar Yishmael, in Bab. only ‘Ula. Y. Succ. IV, 54ᶜ. Y. Gitt. V, 47ᵇ top; Bab. Gitt. 55ᵃ. Hor. 4ᵃ; (Y. ib. I, 46ᵃ top הילא). Y. Maasr. V, 51ᵈ, a. e. עילא, עילה; a. fr.—Y. Kil. IX, 32ᶜ bot. ע׳ נחותא; Y. Keth. XII, 35ᵇ עללא (corr. acc.), v. נָחוֹתָא.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 119ᵇ, sq.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. עוּלָא II'}]

[{'definition': '‘Uḳba, ‘Uḳban, (Mar ‘U.), name of several Amoraim and of one Resh Galutha (or two), commonly named Mar‘U. Snh. 31ᵇ. Pes. 115ᵇ רבנא ע׳. M. Kat. 16ᵇ.—Y. Ber. I, 3ᵃ bot. מר ע׳.—Sabb. 56ᵇ עוקבן בר נחמיה וכ׳ ‘U. son of N., the Resh Galutha; a. e.—Erub. 34ᵇ ע׳ בר חמא Ms. M. (ed. בר אבא, corr. acc.). B. Mets. 65ᵃ. Ber. 44ᵃ מר ע׳ בר ח׳ (Ms. F. רב ע׳). Zeb. 55ᵇ רב ע׳ Ms. M. (ed. מר); a. fr.—Y. Erub. I, 18ᵈ bot. רבי ע׳. Y. Ḥag. II, 78ᵇ top ר׳ עוקבה. Y. Meg. I, 71ᵃ top מר ע׳; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 28; Pesik. Ha‘omer, p. 70ᵇ רב חמא בר ע׳.—V. Fr. M’bo p. 120ᵇ, a. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v.'}]
[{'definition': 'Be-‘Orabti, name of a family. Kidd. 70ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': ', pr. n. m., v. עַזָּת'}]

[{'definition': 'ʿAzzai; שמעון בן ע׳, or בן ע׳ (Simon) Ben Azzai, a Tannai, disciple and colleague of R. ʿĂḳiba. Y. Shek. III, beg. 47ᵇ; Y. B. Bath. IX, end, 17ᵇ; Bab. B. Bath. 158ᵇ, a. e., v. חָבֵר. Ab. IV, 2. Tosef. Maas. Sh. II, 5. Sot. IX, 15. Yeb. 63ᵇ; a. fr.—V. Fr. Darkhé, p. 135 sq.'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿĂzael, name of a fallen angel. Targ. Y. Gen. VI, 4 עוּזִּיאֵל.—Yoma 67ᵇ, a. e., v. עוּזָּא II.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Ezra, 1) the priest and scribe.'}, {'definition': ' the priest and scribe. Succ. 20ᵃ כשנשתכחה … עלה ע׳ מבבל ויסדה when the Law was forgotten in Israel, Ezra came from Babylonia and re-established it. Ber. 27ᵇ; Men. 53ᵃ עשירי לע׳ a descendant of Ezra in the tenth generation. Meg. 15ᵃ מלאכי זה ע׳ Malachi is Ezra; a. v. fr.—(ספר) ע׳ the Book of Ezra (and Nehemiah). B. Bath. 14ᵇ.—[M. Kat. III, 4 (18ᵇ) ספר ע׳, v. עֲזָרָה.]', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' name of several Amoraim. Men. l. c.—Y. Erub. II, beg. 19ᵈ. Y. Taan. IV, 68ᶜ top עֶזְרָה; a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. עֶזְרָא'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Azariah, '}, {'definition': ' A. ben Oded, the prophet. Lev. R. s. 19.—2) one of the Jewish exiles at the Babylonian court, v. חֲנַנְיָא. Sabb. 67ᵃ; a. v. fr.—3) brother of Simon. Zeb. I, 2 שמעון אחי ע׳; Toh. VIII, 7.—Lev. R. s. 25 ע׳ עוסק בפרקמטיא וניתן וכ A. was engaged in trade, and supported his brother Simon. Sot. 21ᵃ.—4) father of R. Elazar, v. אֶלְעָזָר.—5) name of several Amoraim. Y. Ber. I, 2ᵈ top. Y. Sabb. VII, 9ᵇ (prob. identical with R. Ezra). Lev. R. s. 10, beg. Pesik. R. s. 14; Pesik. Par., p. 39ᵃ.—Pesik. R. s. 16 ר׳ ע׳ דכפר חטייה; Pesik. Eth. Korb., p. 61ᵃ; Lev. R. s. 7; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}]
[{'definition': ' (?) ʿAzzath. Snh. 19ᵃ Yoḥăsin (ed. עות; Ms. M. אילת; Ms. F. עזה; Ms. K. עזא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿAṭal. Esth. R. to I, 5 חנינא בר ע׳ (Y. Yeb. VI, 7ᶜ bot. בר עגול).'}]
[{'definition': 'pl. of עֵיטָא;', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' בַּר ע׳ pr. n. m. Bar ʿEṭyan (counsellor). Y. B. Bath. VI, end, 15ᶜ', 'number': '2)'}]

[{'definition': 'ʿIyya, dialectic pronunciation of חִיָּיא. M. Kat. 16ᵇ אמר ליה ע׳ וכ׳ he (Rabbi, being angry with R. Ḥiyyah) said to him, Iyya, who calls thee outside? Ker. 8ᵃ צריכין לדברי ע׳ they still need the interpretation of Iyya (of whom you spoke so contemptuously as ‘the Babylonian’).'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. עוּלָא II'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿIlish. B. Bath. 133ᵇ. Gitt. 45ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿEfa, v. חֵיפָא III.'}]

[{'definition': ' pr. n. m. ʿAkhmai. Y. Ter. XI, end, 48ᵇ; Y. Sabb. II, 4ᵈ top, v. יוֹנָתָן.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' בֶּן עַ׳ pr. n. pl. (?). Yeb. 15ᵇ משפחת בית צבועים מבן ע׳; Y. ib. 3ᵃ bot. משפחת בית ענוביי מבית צבועים.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Akhan, who secreted a portion of the spoils of Jericho. Snh. 44ᵇ, v. preced. Num. R. s. 23. Lev. R. s. 9; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'ʿAkhnai (ʿkhinai). Kel. V, 10 תנורו של ע׳ the oven of ʿA. (consisting of tiles cemented with sand); Ber. 19ᵃ. Ib. מהו ע׳ … שהקיפוהו הלכות כעכנא זה (not כעכנאי) why is it called the oven of A.?… It intimates that they encircled it with discussions as the snake (winds itself around an object; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 7); B. Mets. 59ᵇ כעכנא זו.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Amos, the prophet. Macc. 24ᵃ, v. עָמַד. Lev. R. s. 10, beg. שלחתי את ע׳ וכ׳ I sent Amos, and they named him Psellos (stammerer), v. עָמַס; Koh. R. to I, 1; Pesik. Naḥ., p. 125ᵇ; Yalk. Is. 307. Ned. 38ᵃ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿInyani. Koh. R. to III, 11 ע׳ בר נחשון; (Y. Yoma III, 40ᵈ bot. אינייני בר סוסי).'}]
[{'definition': 'Anan, an Amora, disciple of Samuel. Y. Sabb. III, beg. 5ᶜ. Keth. 69ᵃ; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Aner, one of Abraham’s allies. Gen. R. s. 42; Tanḥ. Vayera 3; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': '‘Atsri. B. Bath. 174ᵇ (Ms. M. עצורי); Arakh. 23ᵃ משה בר ע׳.'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿÃḳabia, name of a Tannai. Ber. 19ᵃ. Eduy. V, 6; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ben ʿAḳosh, (‘Aḳish). Koh. R. to II, 9 (perhaps to be read שאול בן קיש).'}]

[{'definition': '‘Ãḳiba, a renowned Tannai who began to study at an advanced age, and who, after taking part in the insurrection of Bar Kokhba, died a martyr. Yeb. 16ᵃ אתה הוא ע׳ בן יוסף וכ׳ art thou that ʿÃ. ben Joseph whose fame goes from one end of the world to the other? Ab. Zar. 5ᵃ כיון שהגיע לדורו של ר׳ ע׳ when he (Adam, in the revelations he received) came to the days of R. A., he rejoiced &c.; v. עָצַב. Ber. 61ᵇ (the story of his martyrdom). Sot. V, 1. Gen. R. s. 1; a. v. fr.—V. Fr. Darkhé Mish., p. 111 sq.'}]

[{'definition': 'ʿÃḳilas, Aquila, the alleged translator of the Bible into Greek, frequ. surnamed הַגֵּר, the proselyte, and identified with אוּנְקְלוֹס. Y. Meg. I, 71ᶜ top תירגם ע׳ הגר וכ׳ A. the proselyte interpreted the Torah before R. El. and &c., v. יְפיפָה (Bab. ib. 3ᵃ תרגום של תורה אונקלוס הגר אמרו מפיוכ׳). Y. Kidd. I, 59ᵃ top תירגם ע׳ הגר לפני ר"ע A. the proselyte interpreted (the verse Lev. XIX, 20) before R. ʿÃḳiba. Targ. Cant. I, 3, v. אֲתָאנַסְיָא; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿIḳḳesh. Bekh. 38ᵃ חזקיה אבי ע׳.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Er, son of Judah and Tamar. Gen. R. s. 85 ער שהוער מן העולם his name was Er, because he was removed out of the world (died young); Yalk. ib. 145. Yeb. 34ᵇ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': '(b. h.) '}, {'definition': ' pr. n. m. ʿÃrab, son of Ishmael. Targ. Y. Gen. XXV, 13 (h. text קדר).', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': 'Arabia. Targ. Jer. XXV, 24.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'ʿArod. Sifré Deut. 41 בית ע׳, v. אֲרִים.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Esau, son of Isaac; (gent. noun) Esau (Edom), frequ. a disguise for Rome. Yoma 38ᵇ רשע דר … זה ע׳ a wicked man that dwelt between two righteous men without adopting their doings, that is Esau. Gitt. 57ᵇ (ref. to Gen. XXVII, 22) אין לך … מזרעו של ע׳ there is no successful war in which descendants of Esau have no part. Gen. R. s. 2 ויהי ערב ערבו של ע׳ ‘and it was evening’ (Gen. I, 5), the evening (decline) of Esau (Rome). Koh. R. to V, 7 אם ראית ע׳ בכרך הגדול של רומי עושק וכ׳ when thou seest Esau in the large city of Rome oppressing the poor and robbing the indigent &c.; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'Bar ʿAshtor, the progenitor of a family of converts. Y. Bicc. I, 64ᵃ top אילין דבר ע׳ וכ׳ those of the family of B. A. who are converts, sons of converts. Ib. קיימה בנימין בר ע׳ וכ׳ one Benjamin B. A. stood before us (was admitted as witness) in the case of &c.; ib. בר אשתור. Y. Dem. VI, 25ᵇ top.'}]
[{'definition': ' (?) pr. n. m. Pâṭi, v. פַּנְטִי.'}]
[{'definition': 'Pâfi. B. Bath. 25ᵇ פ׳ יונאה (Ms. M. פפי יובא׳; Ms. O. פפי יוכאה; Ms. H. פפי יוכנאה; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).—V. פַּפִּי.'}]

[{'definition': ' (abbrev. of פְּדָיָה) pr. n. m. בר פ׳ Bar-Pada, an Amora. Naz. 5ᵃ; Tem. 10ᵃ. Meïl. 4ᵇ בר פדת (corr. acc.; v. Tosaf. to Tem. l. c.). Macc. 2ᵃ; (Y. ib. I, beg. 31ᵃ בר פדייה); a. fr.—[Treat. Sof’rim XII, 3, v. פַּנְטִי.]'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. P’dayah; בר פ׳ Bar-P’dayah, an Amora. Y. Macc. I, beg. 31ᵃ, v. פָּדָא II. Y. Peah IV, 18ᵇ bot.; Y. Ḥall. III, 59ᵃ bot. רבי פ׳ (corr. acc.). Pesik. Par., p. 37ᵇ; Pesik. R. s. 14 בר פדיון (corr. acc.); Koh. R. to VIII, 1; Yalk. ib. 977. Y. Sabb. I, 3ᵃ bot.; Y. Shek. II, end, 47ᵃ בר פתייא (corr. acc.); a. e.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 70ᵇ'}]

[{'definition': 'P’dath, '}, {'definition': ' father of R. Elazar. Erub. 54ᵇ; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' son of R. Elazar, an Amora. Y. Meg. IV, 75ᶜ top; a. fr.—[Meïl. 4ᵇ, v. פָּדָא II.]', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Puga. B. Bath. 90ᵇ, v. סוּגָא II.'}]
[{'definition': 'Puṭi, a disparaging abbreviation of Putiel. Snh. 82ᵇ, a. e., v. פָּטַם.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Putiel, the father-in-law of Elazar, son of Aaron, in Agadah identified with Jethro (and also with Joseph). Mekh. Yithro, ʿĂmal., s. 1 פ̇וט̇\' שנפ̇ט̇ר מע"ז Jethro was surnamed Putiel, because he withdrew from idolatry. B. Bath. 109ᵇ, a. e., v. פָּטַם a. פּוֹטָא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Poloyah. Ex. R. s. 42 end יהודה בן פ׳, prob. to be read: פדייה; Pesik. R. s. 40 יהודה בר פניי׳ ed. Fr. (ed. Prag פליי׳, v. Friedm. note 48); Yalk. Cant. 988 פדיה.'}]
[{'definition': 'Poʿirah. Kidd. 66ᵃ אלעזר בן פ׳ a counsellor of king Yoḥănan (Jannai).'}]
[{'definition': 'Pushtabna, name of a tall man. Num. R. s. 9 (ed. Leipz. פושתכ׳); Nidd. 25ᵃ top פרשתבינא (read: פוש׳; Ar. פשתיכנא). [Tosaf. to Nidd. l. c. an official title.]'}]

[{'definition': 'Pazzi, (Pazia). Y. Hor. III, end, 48ᶜ; Y. Sabb. XII, 13ᶜ bot. אילין דבר פ׳ members of the family of Bar Pazzi; Y. Sot. IX, end, 24ᶜ דבי פ׳.—Pesik. Par., p. 33ᵃ חנין בר פ׳; Tanḥ. Ḥuck. 5 חנין בן פ׳; Yalk. Num. 759 חנן בר פפי (corr. acc.); Pesik. R. s. 14 יוחנן בן פ׳; Yalk. Ps. 658 שמעון בן פ׳. Pesik. R. s. 15 חנן בן פ׳. Y. Meg. IV, 75ᵃ bot. חנניה בן פ׳; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Paḥorah (Potter). Y. Sot. IX, 24ᵃ bot.; Y. Maas. Sh. V, end, 56ᵈ אלעזר בן פ׳.'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar Paṭṭa, name of a family. Y. M. Kat. III, 81ᵈ bot.'}]
[{'definition': ' (Πέτρος) Petros, Peter. Y. M. Kat. III, 82ᵈ bot. ר׳ יוסי בר פ׳; Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42ᶜ; Gen. R. s. 92; Ex. R. s. 52; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar-Piali. Ḥull. 96ᵃ Ar. (ed. פְּיוֹלִי).'}]

[{'definition': 'Pilia. Lev. R. s. 24 יודן בר פ׳; Y. Ber. IX, 14ᵇ בן פילה; Midr. Till. to Ps. CI פִּלְיָיא ed. Bub. (oth. ed. שילא, corr. acc.). Y. Shebi. V, beg. 35ᵈ פליא Fr. M’bo, p. 95ᵇ (ed. Krot. פדיא).'}]
[{'definition': 'Pinkay. Ker. 28ᵃ; Pes. 57ᵃ פנ׳ (Ms. M. 2 פינ׳; Ms. O. פִּינְקַי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 3).'}]
[{'definition': ' (פָּסַק) Pisḳon (Arguer), surname of the angel Gabriel. Snh. 44ᵇ, v. פָּסַק.—Fem. פִּסְקוֹנִית. Ib. רוח פ׳ (Rashi: פִּסְקָנִית) the arguing spirit (Gabriel). Tanḥ. V’zoth 6.'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar-Piḳa. Y. Naz. IX, 57ᵈ'}]
[{'definition': ' (preced.) Perug. Targ. I Chr. IV, 11 (h. text מחיר).'}]
[{'definition': 'Pishon. Yeb. 107ᵇ פ׳ הגמל Pishon the camel-driver, v. כָּפַשׁ.'}]
[{'definition': 'Pishpashah. Y. Shebi. VI, 36ᶜ bot.'}]
[{'definition': 'Pakhora. Y. Sot. IX, 24ᵃ bot. יהודה בן פ׳; (Y. Maas. Sh. V, end, 56ᵈ פתורה).'}]
[{'definition': 'Pakhsas. Y. Naz. VII, beg. 55ᵈ יוסי בן פ׳; Sifra Emor beg. יוסף בן פ׳.'}]

[{'definition': 'P’lugta, near Tiberias. Num. R. s. 9 כגון הדה בית מעון שיורדים לה מפ׳ וכ׳ like Beth-Maʿon to which they go down when coming from P., and up from Tiberias; (Gen. R. s. 85 כפר שובתי; Y. Sot. I, 17ᵃ bot. פלטתה). Lev. R. s. 5 (ref. to Am. VI, 6) they got their wine מפ̇ל̇וג̇ת̇א שעל יינם נתפ̇ת̇ו וג̇ל̇ו וכ׳ from P., for on account of their wine the ten tribes were led astray, and had to go into exile (v. פְּתוּגְתָּא); Num. R. s. 10; Yalk. Am. 545. Sabb. 147ᵇ חמרא דפרוגייתא (דפרוגיתא).'}]
[{'definition': 'P’loslos. Ab. Zar. III, 4 בן פ׳ Y. ed. a. Mish. Nap. (Mish. ed. פילוספוס, Bab. ed. 44ᵇ פלוספיס; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40); Yalk. Deut. 888 פליספ׳.'}]
[{'definition': 'Palṭa. Y. Ter. X, 47ᵇ bot. לוי בר פ׳ (Lev. R. s. 23 פרטא).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Palti, Paltiel, to whom Michal the daughter of Saul was given as wife, but who, according to tradition, did not live with her because of her betrothal to David. Snh. 19ᵇ; v. פָּלַט; Lev. R. s. 23; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Plaṭia. Koh. R. to I, 4.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. פִּילְיָא'}]

[{'definition': 'P’leṭith, name of a Sodomite woman who, according to a legend, was put to death for feeding a poor family (v. Gen. R. s. 49). Targ. Y. I Gen. XVIII, 21; Pirké d’R. El. ch. XXV פלוטית וכ׳ P. daughter of Lot; Yalk. Gen. 83 פְּלֵטַת.'}]
[{'definition': 'P’limo, name of a Tannai. Pes. 8ᵇ. Men. 37ᵃ. Sot. 4ᵃ, v. פְּנִימוֹן.'}]

[{'definition': ' (philippus, Philippi) Plippa, Pilippi, Pilpi, name of an Amora. Y. Taan. IV, 68ᵇ top (ed. Krot. פליטה, corr. acc.). Y. Meg. IV, 75ᵃ bot. פילפי.—Gen. R. s. 71 פליפי; Yalk. Kings 208 פפי.'}]

[{'definition': ' (an adaptation of πανεγυρίστης) Pangar (Encomiast), name of one of the generals (duces) before Jerusalem under Vespasian. Lam. R. to I, 5 חד אמר קילוס שמיה וחד אמר פ׳ שמיה one says, the name of that dux was Ḳillus (Praise), and one says, his name was Pangar.'}]

[{'definition': 'Panda, '}, {'definition': ' name of an Amora (?). Ber. 55ᵇ (Ms. M. פבנא a. פרנא; En Yaăk. ed. pr., a. Yoḥăsin פרנך, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' בר שיריקא פ׳ name of a demon. Sabb. 67ᵃ (Rashi פנדאי; Ms. M. פניא).', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': 'Pandera, (Panṭera, Panṭeri), surname of Joseph the father of Jesus of Nazareth. Koh. R. to X, 5 חד מן אילין דבר פ׳ one of the followers of the son of P.—Tosef. Ḥull. II, 22; 24; a. fr.; v. יֵשׁוּ.'}]

[{'definition': 'Panṭi. Koh. R. to VIII, 3 לוי בן פ׳; Meg. 31ᵇ בר בוטי (Ms. M. בוטא); Treat. Sof’rim XII, 3 בר פדא; Y. Meg. III, 74ᵇ bot. פאטי (ed. Krot. פסטי; ed. Crac. פכטי); Yalk. Prov. 932 בוטא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Penṭaḳaḳah, surname of one who was said to have committed five sins (πέντα κακά) every day. Y. Taan. I, 64ᵇ bot.'}]

[{'definition': 'Paneas (Cæsaræa Philippi, modern Bânias), a city in the north of Palestine. Targ. Y. I Num. XXXIV, 11 מערת פניאס (not סניאס); (Y. II אפמים, אפמיס; ib. 10 אפמיאה, אפמיאם, v. אַפַּמְיָא). Targ. Cant. V, 4 פָּמִיאַס (some ed. פָּמְיַס). Targ. I Chr. XXI, 2 (h. text דן).—Y. Shebi. IX, 38ᵈ bot. דיקליטינוס אעיק לבני פנ׳ Diocletian oppressed the inhabitants of P. Y. Dem. II, 22ᵈ top. Gen. R. s. 63 נחת … בהדא פנ׳ (Var. פמ׳) he (Diocletian) came down and made his stay at P. Meg. 6ᵃ; Bekh. 55ᵃ לשם זו פמ׳ Leshem is P.; Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 14 ליש זו פ׳ Layish is P.; Pirké d’R. EI. ch. XXVII דן הוא פ׳ Dan is P.; Midr. Sam. ch. XXXII (ref. to דנה, II Sam. XXIV, 6) דנה פ׳. Gen. R. s. 33 מעיין … מערת פ׳ the spring … of the cavern of P.; Bekh. l. c. ירדן יוצא ממערת פ׳ the Jordan issues from the cavern of P.; B. Bath. 74ᵇ.—Yalk. Deut. 820 (Moses prays) אכנס לה במחילה … מתחת לפַמְיָס let me enter Palestine by the cave of Cæsarion, which is below P.; Mekh. B’shall., ʿĂmal., s. 2 לפניי ולפנים (corr. acc.); a. fr.—Tanḥ. Naso 10; Num. R. s. 11 (ref. to Num. VI, 24) יברכד … וישמרך שלא תהא עשוי במדינת פ׳ וכ׳ the Lord bless thee with wealth, and guard thee, that thou be not forced (to take office) in the city (or district) of P., and no zimia (v. זִימְיָא) be decreed over the city, and they say to thee, give gold (a reference to Roman extortions, v. supra).'}]
[{'definition': 'P’nimon. Y. Ter. III, end, 42ᵇ אבא פ׳ Abba P.—Num. R. s. 9 (Tosef. Sot. I, 1 Var. ed. Zuck.; Sot. 4ᵃ פלימו, Y. ib. I, 16ᶜ bot. מיניימין).'}]
[{'definition': ' = אָפֵס, Pas, name of two Amoraim. Y. Taan. IV, 68ᵃ. Y. Yoma V, 43ᵃ bot.—Y. Kidd. III, 64ᵃ bot. (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 122ᵃ).'}]
[{'definition': 'P’saḳa, surname of one R. Yitsḥaḳ. Lam. R. to I, 9 ר׳ יצחק פ׳ (Yalk. Is. 302 יצחק פסיקתא); cmp. פַּסְקַת.'}]
[{'definition': '(?) pr. n. m., v. פַּנְטִי'}]
[{'definition': 'P’sisa. Snh. 91ᵃ, v. גְּבִיעָא.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Zibeon, father of Anah. Pes. 54ᵃ; Gen. R. s. 82; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. פְּסָאקָא'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Zadok, 1) the high priest under David and Solomon.'}, {'definition': ' the high priest under David and Solomon. Yoma 73ᵇ; Sot. 48ᵇ. Snh. 21ᵃ מה צ׳ מחצה וכ׳ as Z. (the high priest) takes one half of the show-bread &c. Koh. R. to I, 4 (ref. to I Chr. VI, 34) ללמדך אילו היה אהרן … צ׳ היה וכ׳ to teach thee that if Aaron and his sons had been alive (in David’s days), Z. would have been their superior in his time; a. e.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' Z., an alleged disciple of Antigonos of Sokho, and founder of the sect of the Sadducees. Ab. d’R. N. ch. V.—3) R. Z., a Tannai, contemporary with the destruction of the Temple. Gitt. 56ᵃ, sq. Yoma 23ᵃ. Ab. IV, 5; a. fr.—V. Fr. Darkhé, p. 70 sq.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Peor, Baal Peor, a Moabite deity. Snh. VII, 6. Ab. Zar. 51ᵇ; a. fr.; v. פָּעַר, a. פְּעַר.'}]
[{'definition': ' (tradit. pronunc. פָּפָּא) pr. n. m. Pappa (Papa), name of several Amoraim. Snh. 49ᵇ, a. fr. רב פ׳ סבא the elder R. Papa. Taan. 6ᵇ; Ber. 59ᵃ. B. Bath. 90ᵇ, v. דּוֹן; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'N’har Pappa, name of a canal and of a place in Babylonia. B. Mets. 86ᵃ Yoma 77ᵇ (Ms. O. פקוד; Ar. a. Ms. Alf. פרת, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 8).—Denom. f. pl. (נְהַר) פַּפְיָתָא belonging to N. P. Erub. 82ᵇ תרתי ריפתא נ׳ פ׳ (Ms. M. פַּפְיָאתָא; ed. Sonc. ריפתאה פפיתאה, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) two loaves of the size baked in N. P.'}]

[{'definition': ' (Πάππος) Pappus, '}, {'definition': ' P. b. Judah, the alleged husband of the mother of Jesus of Nazareth. Sabb. 104ᵇ (missing in editions under censorial supervision). Tosef. Sot. V, 9 כגון פ׳ בן י׳ שהיה נועל וכ׳ (not שנועל) like P. b. J. who locked the door before his wife (refused to live with her on account of a suspicion); Y. ib. I, 17ᵃ bot.; Y. Kidd. IV, 66ᵃ והודה בן פ׳; Gitt. 90ᵃ פ׳ בן י׳; Num. R. s. 9 י׳ בן פ׳.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': 'Pappus (ben Judah), mentioned in connection with לוּלְיָינוֹס, q. v. Sifra B’ḥuck., Par. 2, ch. V; Y. Taan. II, 66ᵃ top פיפוס (corr. acc.); a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': 'Pappus, father of R. Judah, a contemporary of R. Joshua. Y. B. Bath. V, 15ᵃ bot.; Y. Ber. II, end, 5ᵈ.—[Gen. R. s. 21 ר׳ פ׳; Eduy. VII, 5 פפוס Ms. M., v. פַּפְּיָיס.]', 'number': '—3)'}]

[{'definition': 'Pappi, '}, {'definition': ' name of an Amora, son-in-law of R. Yitsḥaḳ Napp’ḥa. Ḥull. 110ᵃ; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' an otherwise unknown person. B. Bath. 48ᵇ Rashi a. Mss. (ed. פאפי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 60).', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': ' a fictitious name in an incantation formula. Gitt. 69ᵃ.—V. פָּאפִי', 'number': '—3)'}]

[{'definition': ' (Παπίας) Papias, name of a Tannai. Eduy. VII, 5, sq. (Ms. M. פפוס, corr. acc.); R. Hash. 6ᵃ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 8); Tem. III, 1. Shek. IV, 7 (early eds. פפוס; Ms. O. פפיאס, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., p. 32, note 90). Yalk. Gen. 34; Gen. R. s. 21 פפוס (corr. acc.); Cant. R. to I, 9 פפיס. Mekh. Yithro, ʿĂmal., s. 1 פפיס.'}]
[{'definition': 'P’ḳoli (Cotton Dealer (?), v. next w.), surname of Simon, a Tannai. Ber. 28ᵇ; Meg. 17ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': 'Parg’riṭa, surname of one R. Samuel. Deut. R. s. 2.'}]

[{'definition': 'Parva, name of a Persian builder and magian, from whom a compartment in the Temple was supposed to have been named: לִשְׁכַּת הַפּ׳ or בֵּית הַפַּ׳. Midd. V, 3. Yoma III, 3; 6; Tosef. ib. I, 20. Yoma 35ᵃ, v. אַמְגּוּשָׁא; Ḥull. 62ᵇ, v. פַּרְוָא. [Our w. is perh. identical with פַּרְוָור.]'}]
[{'definition': 'Parvaah, surname of R. Ḥiya. Ab. Zar. 38ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': ' (Πρόδικος) P’rozdiḳi, P’rozdaḳ. Yalk. Ps. 842; Num. R. s. 12, beg.'}]
[{'definition': 'P’ruḳla (Proclus), a Roman general. Y. Snh. III, 21ᵇ כד עאל פ׳ וכ׳ when P. (with his army) came to Sepphoris.'}]
[{'definition': ' (preced.) Proclus, a gentile. Ab. Zar. III, 4 (44ᵇ) פ׳ בן פילוספוס (Ms. M. פרקולוס; Y. ed. a. Mish. Nap. פרקלוס); Yalk. Deut. 888 פרק׳.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. פְּרִידָא II'}]
[{'definition': 'Parzaḳ. B. Mets. 49ᵇ דקא בעי … דבי פ׳ רופילא that one of the men of lieutenant P. intended to take it by force.'}]
[{'definition': 'P’raṭa, father of R. Eleazar. Gitt. III, 4. Ab. Zar. 17ᵇ; a. e.—[Lev. R. s. 23 לוי בן פ׳, v. פַּלְטָא.]'}]
[{'definition': 'P’rigori, an Amora. Y. Ter. XI, 47ᵈ'}]
[{'definition': 'P’rida, an Amora. Snh. 82ᵃ; 104ᵃ; Yalk. Kings 249.—Y. B. Bath. IX, 17ᵃ ר׳ פְּרִירָא; Y. Peah VII, 20ᵇ top פְּרִירִי (ed. Krot. פְּרוּרִי).'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. פְּרִידָא II'}]
[{'definition': 'Parniṭos. Targ. II Esth. I, 2 (3), prob. corrupt., for אַנְטִיפַּטְרוֹס.'}]
[{'definition': 'Parnakh, an Amora. Meg. 32ᵃ. Y. Pes. V, 32ᶜ bot.; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Pharaoh, the Egyptian king. M. Kat. 18ᵃ פ׳ שהיה בימי משה the Pharaoh of Moses’ time. Ex. R. s. 8 מי גרם לפ׳ שילקה what was the cause of Pharaoh’s being smitten?; a. v. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ḳ’buṭal. Yoma I, 6 (18ᵇ). Y. ib. I, end, 39ᵇ מה ניתני קְבוּטַר ק׳ how shall we read it? Ḳ’buṭar or Ḳ’buṭal?, v. צְפַר III; Bab. ib. 19ᵇ (to one that read קפוטל) מחוי … בידיה קב׳ Rab showed him with his hand Ḳ’buṭal (drawing a Beth in the air; differ. in Ms. M., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes 3, 4). Ber. 63ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Pethuel, father of the prophet Joel. Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXX; a. e.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ḳ’busay, Ḳ’fusay, father of R. Joshua (v. Fr. Darkhé, p. 187). Tosef. Mikv. VI, 3 (Var. קוּפְסַאי). Tosef. Makhsh. III, 15; Tosef. Dem. I, 14 קופס׳ (Var. קבוס׳, קביס׳); Y. ib. III, 23ᶜ bot. קבסיי. Tosef. Bekh. III, 19 קפו׳; Bab. ib. 35ᵇ קפי׳. Ib. 39ᵃ קְפוּצַאי; Tosef. ib. IV, 5 קפוס׳. Sabb. 147ᵃ כְּפוּסַאי (Ms. M. נפוצי, read כ for נ). Ab. Zar. 32ᵃ קפו׳; Tosef. ib. IV (V), 10 קופ׳. Y. Pes. VI, 33ᵃ bot. קבסיו (corr. acc.).'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. פְּתֵירָה'}]

[{'definition': ' pr. n. m. = בְּתֵירָה. Tosef. Naz. V, 1 יהודה בן פ׳ ed. Zuck. (Var. ב׳); Tosef. Ohol. IV, 14 פתירוש (Ḥull. 54ᵃ ב׳; v. Fr. Darké, p. 97). Tosef. Sot. V, 13; VI, 1 בן פטורי (Var. פטירי). Tosef. Eduy. III, 2 יהושע בן פ׳; ib. שמעון בן פ׳ (Eduy. VIII, 1 sq. ב׳); Y. Shek. III, 47ᶜ פתורא.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. קַתְרוֹס II'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Koheleth, traditional surname of King Solomon. Koh. R. to I, 1 למה נקרא שמו ק׳ … בהִקָּהֵל וכ׳ why was his name Koheleth? Because his words were proclaimed in public meeting, as it is written (I Kings VIII, 1) &c.; a. e.—ק׳ (ספר) the Book of Koheleth, Ecclesiastes. B. Bath. 14ᵇ סידרן … ק׳ וכ׳ the order of the books of Hagiographa is: Ruth, Psalms, Job, Proverbs, Ecclesiastes &c. Ib. 15ᵃ משלי … ק׳ אנשי וכ׳ the men of the Great Assembly composed Proverbs, Song of Songs and Ecclesiastes. Sabb. 30ᵇ בקשו … ספר ק׳ וכ׳ the scholars wanted to exclude from the canon (v. גָּנַז) the book of E., because its words contradict one another; Koh. R. to I, 3; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': ' (Colonus) אבא ק׳ AbbaḲolon, a legendary person connected with the foundation of Rome. Cant. R. to I, 6.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳunia. Tosef. Makhsh. III, 3 R. S. to Makhsh. VI, 2 (ed. Zuck. a. oth. קְוִינָא).'}]
[{'definition': ', pr. n. m. (Constantinus) Constantine, Roman emperor, v. preced.'}]
[{'definition': ', pr. n. m., v. קוּזִּית'}]

[{'definition': ' pr. n. pl. Be-Ḳuppaë. Ber. 31ᵃ, v. כֵּיפֵי.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' pr. n. gent. Beth-Ḳuppaë. Yeb. 15ᵇ משפחת ב׳ ק׳ מבן מקושש the family of Beth-Ḳuppaë (in Jerusalem) of Ben-M’ḳoshesh; Y. ib. I, 3ᵃ bot. משפחת בית נקיפי מבית קושש.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ', pr. n. m., v. קַצְרָא II'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. קַצְרָא II'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳuryah. Gen. R. s. 19 אבא בר ק׳; v. בַּרְקִירְיָיא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳorias. Y. Orl. II, 62ᵃ ר׳ ק׳ (ed. Amst. ביריית; v. Fr. M’bo, p. 122ᵃ; p. 69ᵃ).'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳaṭṭin. Yoma III, 10 (37ᵃ) בן ק׳ (Ms. O. קטן) Ben Ḳ.; Tosef. ib. II, 2; Y. Shek. V, beg. 48ᶜ'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳaṭṭina, name of an Amora. Ber. 59ᵃ. B. Mets. 79ᵃ; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (preced.) '}, {'definition': 'dwarfed, puny. Yalk. Dan. 1062, v. פּוּשְׁקָא.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' pr. n. m. Ḳ’ṭiʿa. Ab. Zar. 10ᵇ ק׳ בר שלום name of a gentile Roman counsellor, who suffered death for pleading in favor of the Jews, saying to the emperor, They will call thee מלכותא קטיעא (v. preced.); Yalk. Ez. 373.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳaṭariḳi (?), surname of R. Yitsḥaḳ. Pesik. R. s. 14; Pesik. Parah, p. 39ᵃ (prob. to be read קרטגיני, v. Bub. note 168).'}]

[{'definition': 'Ben-Ḳiṭṭunta, surname of one José (v. קִטּוּנִית). Sot. IX, 15 (Y. ed. 17; Sot. 49ᵃ) יוסי בן ק׳ Y. ed. (Bab. ed. בן קטנתא, Mish. ed. יוסי קטנותא); Y. ib. IX, end, 24ᶜ יוסי קטו׳; Tosef. ib. XV, 5 אַבָּה יוסי … בן קיטנית (Var. איש קטנתא). Y. B. Kam. III, 3ᵈ הוא יוסי הבבלי … הוא יוסי קטונתה José the Babylonian, J. b. Judah, and José Ḳiṭṭunta are one and the same person (cmp. Pes. 113ᵇ).'}]
[{'definition': ', בן ק׳ pr. n. m., v. קִיטּוּנְתָּא'}]
[{'definition': ' (v. next w.) Ḳillus (Praise), name of a general under Vespasian. Lam. R. to I, 5, v. פַּנְגַּר.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) Cain, son of Adam. Snh. IV, 5 שכן מצינו בק׳ וכ׳ for so we find with reference to Cain when he had killed his brother &c. Ib. 37ᵇ מלמד שעשה ק׳ וכ׳ this use of the plural (דמי, Gen. IV, 10) shows that C. inflicted many wounds and bruises on his brother &c. Gen. R. s. 2 ובהו זה ק׳ וכ׳ ‘and void’ (Gen. I, 2), this refers to Cain who intended to reduce the world to waste and voidness; a. v. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳisma. Snh. 98ᵃ יוסי בן ק׳; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': ' הַקַּ׳ Haḳḳayaf. Par. III, 5 הקיף (Mish. ed. הקוף; Ar. a. ed. Dehr. הקייף).'}]
[{'definition': ' (cmp. b. h. קֵירֹס) Ḳeris, an Amora. Y. Bets. II, end, 61ᵈ ק׳ דאירמא; Y. Sabb. V, end, 7ᶜ ק׳ דידמא (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 122ᵃ).'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) Kish, the father of king Saul. Meg. 12ᵇ בן ק̇יש̇ הק̇יש̇ וכ׳, v. נָקַשׁ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳallah, name of a servant of R. Judah the Nasi. Y. Bets. I, 60ᵈ ק׳ דרומא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳathros. Pes. 57ᵃ בית ק׳ name of a priestly family, (supposed to be identical with Κανθηρᾶς, Jos. Ant. XX, 1, 3); Tosef. Men. XIII, 21 קַדְרוֹס.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Reaiah. Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 13 (ref. to I Chr. IV, 2) ר׳ שהראה וכ׳ Bezalel was surnamed Reaiah (v. preced.), for the Lord showed it to all Israel that &c.'}]

[{'definition': ' (= רב בא) Raba (bar Joseph), a Babylonian Amora, chief of the academy of Maḥoza (v. Graetz, Gesch. d. Jud.1 IV, p. 414 sq.). Keth. 105ᵇ. B. Bath. 159ᵇ, v. אַדְּ־; a. v. fr.—[Y. Bets. I, 60ᵇ ר׳ אבא בר יוסף.]—[Y. Yeb. IV, 6ᵃ אמר רבא, read: ר׳ בא.]'}]

[{'definition': ' (= רַב אַבָּה) Rabbah, name of several Amoraim, esp. a) R. bar Naḥmani, chief of the college of Pumb’ditha (v. Grætz, Gesch. d. Jud.1 IV, p. 400 sq.) Gitt. 3ᵃ. Hor. 14ᵃ ר׳ עוקר הרים R. uproots mountains (is ingenious, v. הַר). B. Mets. 86ᵃ; a. v. fr.—b) R. Zuṭi (Junior). B. Bath. 120ᵃ. Men. 31ᵇ; a. e.—c) R. bar Ḥanah. Snh. 5ᵃ.—d) R. bar bar Ḥanah, known for his fables. B. Bath. 73ᵇ; a. fr. [Y. Ber. II, 4ᵇ אבא בר בר ח׳.]—e) R. bar Abbuha (Abbahu, v. Fr. M’bo, p. 60ᵃ). Bekh. 34ᵃ. B. Kam. 46ᵇ; a. e.—f) R. bar Matt’nah. Hor. l. c.; a. e.; a. others.'}]
[{'definition': ' (= רב אבין) Rabbin, Rabin, an Amora. Pes. 25ᵃ, a. fr. כי אתא ר׳ when R. came (to Babylonia). Ib. 34ᵇ כי סליק ר׳ when R. came up (to Palestine); a. fr.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 60ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': ' (= רב אבינא) Rabina, Rabbina, name of several Amoraim. B. Mets. 86ᵃ. Ḥull. 43ᵇ מר בריה דרב א׳. Ib. 46ᵇ; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': ' (contr. of רב אמי) Rabammi. Y. Ab. Zar. V, 45ᵇ. Ib. 45ᵃ bot.'}]

[{'definition': ' (= רב בנאי) Rabbannai, an Amora. B. Mets. 2ᵃ (Ms. M. רבינא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); ib. 27ᵃ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 400); (B. Kam. 113ᵇ ed. רבינא, Ms. M. רבנא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 30). Bets. 15ᵇ bot. Keth. 21ᵇ top. Ḥull. 76ᵇ (Ms. H. a. F. רב בנאי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 2).'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. (b. h.) pr. n. m. Kemuel, name of an angel. Pesik. R. s. 20.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ḳimḥith, the mother of seven sons who served as highpriests in turn. Y. Meg. I, 72ᵃ bot.; Y. Yoma I, 38ᵈ top כל קימחיא קמח וקימחא דק׳ וכ׳ (not דקימחיה) all flours are flour, but the flour of Ḳimḥith is fine flour; Lev. R. s. 20. Y. Yoma V, 42ᵇ בן ק׳ a son of Ḳ.; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳamtsa; בר ק׳ Bar Ḳamtsa. Gitt. 55ᵇ אק׳ ובר ק׳ חריב וכ׳ through an affair concerning Ḳ. and Bar Ḳ. Jerusalem was destroyed; Lam. R. to IV, 2 בין ק׳ ובין בן ק׳ חרב מקדשא.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ben Ḳamtsar (denom. of קֹמֶץ, writing four letters simultaneously with four pens between his fingers). Yoma III, 11. Ib. 38ᵇ; Y. ib. III, end, 41ᵇ; Cant. R. to III, 6 של בית ק׳ those of the house of Ḳ.'}]
[{'definition': 'R’difah. Y. Shebi. IX, 39ᵃ top יצחק בר ר׳.—Y. Kidd. II, 62ᵈ רבי ר׳. Y. Peah IV, 18ᵇ bot.; a. e. (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 123ᵇ).'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳasgalgas, a contraction of Caius Caligula, the Roman emperor. Tosef. Sot. XIII, 6 ed. Zuck. (Var. גס קלגוס, גסקלנוס), v. גַּיּוּס.'}]

[{'definition': 'Romulus, the legendary founder of Rome in conjunction with his brother Remus. Midr. Till. to Ps. X (ref. to Ps. LXVIII, 6, a. X, 14) רומוס ור׳ מתה אמם וכ׳ the mother of Remus and Romulus was dead, and a she-wolf was appointed (by Providence) to give them suck, and they built two large huts in Rome; Yalk. ib. 652. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39ᶜ רומס ורומילס, v. צְרִיף. Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII, 14, אלו שני יתומין … רומוס ור׳ וכ׳ (not ורימילוס) this refers to the two orphans …, R. and R. for whom thou didst appoint a wolf &c.; Yalk. ib. 671; Esth. R. to I, 9 רומוס ורמילוס.'}]
[{'definition': 'Remus, v. preced.'}]

[{'definition': 'Romanus, an Amora (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 123ᵇ). Y. Sabb. III, end, 6ᶜ; Bab. Sabb. 47ᵃ. Y. Bicc. I, 64ᵃ (רומינוס); Y. Yeb. VIII, 9ᵇ bot.; Y. Kidd. IV, 66ᵇ top (רומינוס). Y. Meg. I, 72ᵇ bot.; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ronya, a gardener. B. Mets. 109ᵃ. B. Bath. 5ᵃ top.'}]
[{'definition': 'Haḳḳappar surname of R. Eliezer. Ab. IV, 21. Ber. 63ᵃ.—Y. Shebi. VI, 36ᶜ בן הק׳, v. next w.'}]
[{'definition': 'Roʿets. Macc. 8ᵃ; Snh. 4ᵃ יהודה בן ר׳; Yalk. Deut. 920.'}]
[{'definition': 'Rufus, usu. טורנוס ר׳, v. טוּרְנוֹס. Y. Taan. IV, 69ᵇ bot. חרש ר׳ … את ההיכל Rufus, … carried the plough over the Temple site; Lam. R. to I, 13 רופש (corr. acc.).'}]
[{'definition': ' (= רב אחבא) Raḥăba, an Amora. Pes. 13ᵇ; 52ᵇ; Succ. 45ᵃ. Bets. 11ᵇ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 1). Ber. 18ᵃ; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳatsia, name of a legendary king residing behind the Dark Mountains (v. חשֶׁךְ). Gen. R. s. 33; Lev. R. s. 27; Y. B. Mets. II, 8ᶜ bot.; Tanḥ. Emor 6; Yalk. Ps. 727.'}]
[{'definition': 'R’ḥumi, an Amora. Keth. 62ᵇ. Pes. 39ᵃ. Naz. 13ᵃ בן ר׳; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. קַצְרָא II'}]

[{'definition': ' (preced.) pr. n. m. Ḳatsra (Fuller). Y. Kil. IX, 32ᵇ; Y. Keth. XII, 35ᵃ; Koh. R. to VII, 11.—Esth. R. to I, 13 ר׳ יוסי בר ק׳ (some ed. קַצְרַת); Gen. R. s. 72 בן קוצרי; Cant. R. to VI, 4 בר קסרין; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 9ᵃ ר׳ יוסי ובר קצה (corr. acc.). Y. B. Bath. X, 17ᶜ ר׳ יסא קוצירא. Sabb. 151ᵇ bot. ר׳ יוסי בן קְצַרְתָּה (Ms. M. קצרתא). Midr. Sam. ch. XXVI ר׳ יצחק בר קצרתה; Y. R. Hash. I, 56ᵇ בר קצצתה.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ḳardu in Babylonia (cmp. Kardunias, Schr. KAT2, p. 348; KGF, p. 534). B. Bath. 91ᵃ עשר … ושבע בק׳ (Ar. בכַרְדּוּ) Abraham was ten years in prison, three in Cuthi and seven in Ḳardu; Yalk. Gen. 77 בקדרו; Pirké d’R. El. ch. XXVI קרדי.—Yeb. 115ᵇ קוּרְטְבָא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Rishshai. Ḥull. 80ᵃ Ar. (Ms. H. רִישַׁאי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 90; ed. דושאי).'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar Ḳardima. Koh. R. to X, 8 שוק דבר ק׳ the market or open place of B. Ḳ.'}]

[{'definition': ' m. of Ḳirva; pr. n. m. Ḳirvaya. Sabb. 45ᵇ, v. סִרְוָיָא.—Tosef. Maas. Sh. IV, 5 אבא חילפא בן ק׳ ed. Zuck. (Var. חלקיה מן קרויה); Y. ib. IV, beg. 54ᵈ אבא בר חילפיי בר קריי׳ (Levy, Neuh. Wört. quotes קירויא); B. Bath. 123ᵃ אבא חליפא קרויא (Ms. M. only אבא חלפתא; Ms. R. קִרְוָיָיה; Ms. H. קִירְוָיָה; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 90).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Korah, leader of a rebellion against Moses. Tosef. Snh. XIII, 9 ק׳ ועדתו וכ׳ Korah and his followers have no share in the world to come; Snh. 109ᵇ עדת ק׳ וכ׳ the followers of K. have &c. Ib. ק׳ שנעשה קרחה וכ׳ (Ms. M. שעשה) he is named Korah (Bald), because baldness (depopulation) was created in Israel; a. v. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳorḥah, father of R. Joshua (v. Fr. Darkhé, p. 178). Meg. 28ᵃ. Sabb. 152ᵃ, v. גַּוְזַנְיָא. Snh. VII, 5; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shaul, Saul, '}, {'definition': ' king of Israel. Meg. 14ᵃ ש׳ ויהוא וכ׳ Saul and Jehu, who were anointed out of a flask. Yoma 22ᵇ; Yalk. Sam. 117, v. עָנָה II. Sot. 10ᵃ ש׳ בצוארו Saul (bore a divine appearance) by reason of his neck (high stature); a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' אַבָּא שָׁ׳ Abba Shaul, a Tannai (v. Fr. Darkhé, p. 176 sq.). Tosef. Ter. VII, 2. Tosef. Kil. IV, 10. Yeb. 3ᵃ. Sabb. 133ᵇ; a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': ' Gen. R. s. 94 ר׳ יוחנן בר ש׳ ed. Wil. (oth. ed. שְׁאוּלָה).', 'number': '—3)'}]
[{'definition': ' (?) Sheulah, v. שָׁאוּל.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sh’ilta. Gitt. 39ᵇ (marg. correction שִׁילֵת).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shebuel, proposed as a secondary substitute (כִּינּוּי כִּינּוּי) for שְׁבוּעָה. Ned. 10ᵇ כינויי כינויין דשבועה היכי דמי ש׳ וכ׳ what are secondary substitutes for sh’bu‘ah? Like Sh’buel, Sh’buthiel, Sh’ḳuḳel; ש׳ ש׳ … משמע וכ׳ but could Sh’buel be used, as it may represent the proper noun Shebuel ben Gershom? Say Sh’bubel.'}]

[{'definition': 'Ḳ’rispa, v. כְּרִיסְפָּא. Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42ᵈ (Var. קְרִיסְפְּדַאי). Y. R. Hash. I, 57ᵃ bot קרוס׳ ed. Krot. Ib. II, 58ᵇ top; Y. Snh. I, 18ᶜ bot. קְרִיסְפְּדָא. Y. Shek. VII, 50ᶜ. Y. Yeb. I, 2ᶜ top קְרִיסְפִּי. Y. Snh. III, 21ᵇ bot. Y. M. Kat. III, end, 83ᵈ קְרוּסְפִּי.'}]

[{'definition': ' (tradit. pronunc. רָמִי) pr. n. m. (= ר׳ אמי) Rammi (Rami), name of several Amoraim. Keth. 87ᵇ, a. fr. ר׳ בר חמא. Ḥull. 20ᵇ, a. fr. ר׳ בר יחזקאל (Y. Erub. II, 22ᶜ top אמי בר יחזקאל); a. others.'}]

[{'definition': 'Shabor (Sapor I), king of Persia, friend of Samuel. Ber. 56ᵃ.—Trnsf. a surname of Samuel, and of Raba as influential men. B. Bath. 115ᵇ; Pes. 54ᵃ אמינא מילתא דש׳ מלכא … ומנו שמואל I will say something which king Shabor could not say; and who is meant by that? Samuel; ib. ומנו רבא; B. Bath. l. c. רבה (Ms. M. רבא); Yalk. Num. 774.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ḳarna. Sabb. 108ᵃ. B. Bath. 89ᵃ'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shebna, '}, {'definition': ' officer in high position in King Hezekiah’s court. Lev. R. s. 5. Snh. 26ᵇ ש׳ בעל הנאה היה Shebna was a sensual man; a. e.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' a brother of Hillel. Sot. 21ᵃ, v. עִסְקָא', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. (b. h.) pr. n. m. Sabbethai. Yoma 83ᵃ; B. Bath. 90ᵇ ש׳ אצר פירי, v. אַצָּר. Bets. 32ᵇ ש׳ בר מרינוס. Y. Shebi. II, 34ᵃ ר׳ ש׳ דצדוקי (ed. Krot. שִׁי׳). Y. Succ. IV, end, 54ᵈ ר׳ שׁוּ׳. Y. Ḥall. II, 58ᶜ. Y. Snh. VIII, beg. 26ᵃ; Bab. Snh. 69ᵃ; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': 'the planet Saturn. Sabb. 156ᵃ האי מאן דבש׳ יהי גבר דמחשבוהי בטלין Ms. O. (ed. מחשבתיה) he who was born under Saturn shall be a man whose plans will be frustrated (בטל being the Chald. equivalent of שָׁבַת). Gen. R. s. 10 יש מזל … והוא ש׳ there is a planet which completes its circuit in thirty years; it is Saturn. Pirké d’R. El. ch. VI יום רביעי ש׳ Saturn rules on the fourth day of the week. Pesik. R. s. 20; a. e.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'S’gabion. Tosef. Ter. II, 13 ש׳ ראש בית וכ׳ ed. Zuck. (Var. שביון) S. chief of the synagogue of Achzib.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sh’gar, one of Haman’s ancestors. Targ. Esth. V, 1; Targ. II Esth. III, 1.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shobach, an Ammonite general. Sot. VIII, 1 בני … של ש׳ the Ammonites went into battle relying on the strength of Sh. Ib. 42ᵇ כתיב ש׳ וכתיב שופך the name is once written Shobach (II Sam. X, 16), and once Shophach (I Chr. XIX, 16); חד אמר … עשוי כשׁוֹבָךְ one authority says, his real name was Shophach, and he was called Shobach, because he was built like a dove-cote (of high stature, v. next w.), v. שָׁפַךְ.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shobal, homiletical surname of Bezalel. Ex. R. s. 40, s. שׁוֹבָךְ.'}]
[{'definition': 'Sh’visḳ’el, a nickname for Ezekiel (v. next w.). Kidd. 70ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': 'Shizpar. R. Hash. 22ᵃ ש׳ ראשה וכ׳ (Ms. M. 2 שיזפר; Ms. M. 1 שחפו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) Sh. the magistrate of Geder.'}]

[{'definition': 'Shibb’tha, name of an evil spirit that endangers the health of those that eat food touched with unwashed hands. Yoma 77ᵇ (Ms. M. 2 סִיבְּתָא); Ḥull. 107ᵇ (v., however, Tosaf. a. l.). Taan. 20ᵇ מילתא דש׳ הוה גמיר he had a tradition about Sh.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shez’bi, an Amora. Yoma 81ᵃ; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'Shayya (prob. abbrev. of אוֹשַׁעְיָא). Zeb. 34ᵇ (Ms. R. 1 שישא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 9). Sabb. 66ᵃ רבא בר שָׁאיָיא Ms. O. (Ms. M. שיאה, ed. שירא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 5).'}]
[{'definition': ' (cmp. אַשְׁיָאן) Sh’yan, an Amora. Y. Bicc. III, 65ᵈ top; (Midr. Sam. ch. VII אשיין). Y. Erub. I, 19ᵃ top שין; ib. 19ᵇ top שיין.'}]

[{'definition': 'Shila, name of several Amoraim. B. Bath. 172ᵃ רבא בר רב ש׳ (רבה) (ed. Pes. שייא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 10). Snh. 98ᵇ דבי רבי ש׳ those of the house (or school) of R. Sh.—Nidd. 26ᵃ ש׳ איש כפר תמרתא.—Y. Sabb. II, 5ᵃ top רבי ש׳ דינוה; Ruth R. to II, 19, a. e., v. נָוֶה III.—Y. Snh. VIII, beg. 26ᵃ ר׳ ש׳ בר בינא; Y. Gitt. II, 44ᵇ בינה שילוח (prob. to be read: ש׳ בר בינא).—Y. Macc. II, 31ᵈ bot. ר׳ שִׁילֹה.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 124ᵇ.—Gitt. 69ᵃ (in a charm formula) אנא פפי ש׳ בר סומקי.—Gen. R. s. 64, beg., v. next w.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) '}, {'definition': ' pr. n. pl. Shilo, the seat of the Tabernacle after the conquest. Meg. 16ᵇ בכה על משכן ש׳ וכ׳ he (Benjamin) wept over the Tabernacle of Shiloh, which was to be in the dominion of Joseph &c.; Yalk. Gen. 152. Macc. 12ᵃ והוא … של ש׳ he (Joab) took hold of the altar of Shiloh, opp. to בית עולמים. Zeb. 61ᵇ; a. fr.—B. Bath. 75ᵇ אלף ושני ש׳ וכ׳ (Ar. שִׁילֵי pl.; Ms. M. אלף שתישל, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) an area of one thousand and two times that of Shiloh built up with palaces (v. טִיטְרַפְלִיּוֹת); [Rashb. שיל"ה the numerical value of Shiloh = 345].', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' (interchanging with שילא) Shilo, (Shila), name of a fictitious town, v. יוֹחָנָא I. Gen. R. s. 40, beg. שילו; ib. s. 25, end; ib. s. 64, beg. שילא; Midr. Sam. ch. XXVIII שילה; Ruth R. to I, 1 שילא.', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': ' pr. n. m. Shilo, homiletical name of the King Messiah. Gen. R. s. 98 (ref. to Gen. XLIX, 10) עד … ש׳ זה מלך וכ׳ ‘until Sh. comes’, this means the King Messiah. Snh. 98ᵇ ש׳ שמו his (the Messiah’s) name will be Shiloh.—V. preced.', 'number': '—3)'}]
[{'definition': 'Shilath. Y. Meg. IV, 75ᵃ bot. שמואל בר ש׳ (רב). B. Bath. 8ᵇ. Erub. 28ᵃ; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shimi, name of several Amoraim. Men. 29ᵃ, a. fr. ש׳ בר חייא. Ib. ש׳ את art thou Shimi (and askest such a question)?; ib. 110ᵃ. Tem. 28ᵃ ש׳ בר אשי; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shira. Sabb. 66ᵃ, v. שׁיָּיא.'}]
[{'definition': ') pr. n. m. Shisha, (Sisa), an Amora. Ber. 24ᵃ Ms. M. (ed. ששת). Ḥull. 44ᵃ; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shishna. Y. Sabb. XIX, 16ᵈ bot. רב ש׳ quot. in Alf. (ed. שׁשעה). Gitt. 62ᵃ; Men. 90ᵃ רב דימי בר ש׳.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shikhḥath. B. Bath. 26ᵃ; B. Kam. 91ᵇ Ms. M. (ed. שיבחה; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). B. Bath. 126ᵇ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 80).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.)'}, {'definition': ' pr. n. m. Shechem, son of Hamor the Hivite. Macc. 11ᵃ, a. e., v. גְּזַר. Sot. 22ᵇ, v. שִׁיכְמִי; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' pr. n. pl. Shechem in Mount Ephraim. Gen. R. s. 97, end (ref. to Gen. XLVIII, 22, v. preced.) זו ש׳ ודאי it means Shechem in reality. Ib. (in a corrupt passage) לפיכך תהא הש׳ בחלקך therefore shall the district of Sh. (or the mountain range, v. preced.) be in thy share. Ib. בש׳ נפרצה וכ׳ in Sh. did unchastity break out, and thou didst fence it in (setting the example of chastity), therefore &c. Num. R. s. 23, v. נִיפּוֹלִין; a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shechaniah, the tenth in the order of priests’ divisions. Pesik. Haʿomer, p. 69ᵇ (not שב׳); a. e., v. יֵשׁוּעַ.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shallum, '}, {'definition': ' husband of Huldah the prophetess. Meg. 14ᵇ (counted among the prophets). Yalk. Kings 233.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' name of several Amoraim. Lev. R. s. 26 רב ש׳. Pesik. R. s. 3 יהודה הלוי ברבי ש׳; ib. s. 5; a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Solomon, king of Israel. Ber. 10ᵃ כנגד מי אמר ש׳ וכ׳ with reference to whom did Solomon say that verse (Prov. XXXI, 26)? Snh. 20ᵇ בתחלה מלך ש׳ על העליונים וכ׳ Solomon ruled first over those on high &c. Y. ib. II, 20ᶜ ירד מלאך … ש׳ וכ׳ an angel came down in the image of S. and made him rise from his throne &c.; Koh. R. to II, 2. Pes. 36ᵇ אפי׳ כמצות של ש׳ even unleavened cakes like those of Solomon (of the finest flour) may be used on the Passover; Y. ib. II, 29ᵇ bot. מצה שלמה (insert של, or read: מַצַּת).'}]
[{'definition': 'Shelemia, father of חיננא. B. Bath. 111ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': 'Ben-Shalkuth (Shalḳith). Nidd. 52ᵇ; Tosef. ib. VI, 5.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shem, son of Noah. Meg. 9ᵇ (ref. to Gen. IX, 27) דבריו … באהלי שם let the speech of Japheth (Greek) dwell in the tents of Shem; v. יָפְיוּת. Gen. R. s. 63, v. עֵבֶר I. Snh. 69ᵇ. Ex. R. s. 18 the Lord said, חייב אני לשם אביהם וכ׳ I am indebted to their (the Assyrians’) father Shem, because he and Japheth took their cloaks and covered with it &c.; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': 'Shammai (abbrev. of שמעיה), '}, {'definition': ' (הזקן) ש׳ Sh., the colleague of Hillel in the Sanhedrin under king Herod. Ḥag. II, 2. B. Bath. 133ᵇ; Y. Ned. V, end, 39ᵇ. Succ. II, 8, a. e. ש׳ הזקן. Eduy. I, 1 sq. (differences between Sh. and Hillel). Ib. 4; a. v. fr.—בֵּית שַׁ׳ (abbrev. ב"ש) the school of Sh., the disciples of Sh. Ib. 7. Bets. I, 1; a. v. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' name of an Amora. Y. Sabb. III, 5ᵈ bot.; a. fr. V. Fr. M’bo, p. 124ᵇ', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shamgar, one of the Judges of Israel. Ruth R. to I, 1. Tanḥ. Aḥăré 12; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': ' (preced.) Sh’madon, name of a demon. Gen. R. s. 36 שידא ש׳ (not שמר׳; Ar. אשמדון; cmp. אַשְׁמְדַאי); Yalk. ib. 61.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shammua, father of R. Eleazar. Yeb. 62ᵇ. Erub. 53ᵃ; a. fr.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shamhazzai, name of a fallen angel. Targ. Y. Gen. VI, 4.—Nidd. 61ᵃ סיחון … בר ש׳ הוו Sihon and Og were the sons of Aḥiah son of Sh.'}]

[{'definition': 'Samlai, name of several Amoraim. [Tradit. pronunc. Simlai.] Y. Sabb. I, 3ᵈ; Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41ᵈ bot. ש׳ הדרומי; Bab. Ab. Zar. 36ᵃ ש׳ לודאה; ib. 37ᵃ (attendant of R. Judah han-Nasi). Pes. 62ᵇ. Ib. 121ᵇ. Y. Shek. IV, 48ᵃ top.—B. Bath. 111ᵃ (Ms. H. שמלא). Y. Meg. I, 72ᶜ bot.; Y. Taan. II, 65ᵈ bot. שמליי; Koh. R. to III, 14, v. בֵּירָא 3; a. fr.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 127ᵃ'}]
[{'definition': 'Shimmon, v. שִׁמְעוֹן.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Simeon, Simon, '}, {'definition': ' the son of Jacob; the tribe of Simeon. Gen. R. s. 71 ש̇מ̇ע̇ון ש̇ומ̇ע בקול וכ׳ Simeon (listener), listening to the voice of his father in heaven. Num. R. s. 27 ש׳ פטדה the jewel in the high priest’s breastplate for the tribe of S. was a topaz. Num. R. s. 1319 נשיא ש׳ the prince of the tribe of S.; a. fr.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' ש׳ הצדיק Simon the Just, a high priest. Yoma 69ᵃ כיון שראה לש׳ הצ׳ וכ׳ when he (Alexander the Great) saw Simon the Just, he alighted from his chariot &c. Ab. I, 2 ש׳ הצ׳ היה וכ׳ Simon the Just was one of the last members of the Great Assembly; a. fr.', 'number': '—2)'}, {'definition': ' name of several Tannaim, esp. a) S. son of Hillel. Sabb. 15ᵃ.—b) R. S. son of the Sagan. Shek. VIII, 5. Keth. II, 8; a. e.—c) S. ben Sheṭaḥ, chief of the Pharisees under Alexander Jannai. Ḥag. II, 2. Tosef. Keth. XII, 1. Kidd. 66ᵃ; a. fr.—d) R. S. ben Gamliel I (abbrev. רשב"ג) Ker. I, 7. Succ. 53ᵃ; Tosef. ib. IV, 4. Ab. Zar. 20ᵃ; (Y. ib. I, 40ᵃ bot.; Y. Ber. IX, 13ᵇ bot. רבן גמליאל); a. e.—e) Rabban S. ben Gamliel II. Hor. 13ᵇ. Keth. 77ᵃ, a. fr. כל מקום ששנה רשב"ג וכ׳ wherever R. S. b. G. is cited in the Mishnah, his opinion is the adopted law. Ib. VII, 9; a. v. fr.—f) ר׳ ש׳ ברבי R. S. son of R. Judah han-Nasi (B’ribbi). Ib. 103ᵇ. Ber. 13ᵇ; a. fr.—ש׳ בן זומא, v. זוֹמָא II.—ש׳ בן עזאי, v. עַזַּאי; a. many other Tannaim; v. Fr. Darkhé, Additamenta, p. 64–67.', 'number': '—3)'}, {'definition': ' name of several Amoraim, esp. a) R. S. bar Abba (Ba, Va), in Babli שִׁמָּן. Y. Sabb. VII, 8ᵃ bot.; Bab. Sabb. 61ᵃ. Y. Ber. V, 9ᵇ bot.; Bab. Ber. 33ᵃ; a. fr.—b) R. S. b. Laḳish (abbrev. רשב"ל, a. ריש לקיש, ר"ל). Keth. 54ᵇ. Gitt. 47ᵃ. Y. Yeb. VIII, 9ᵈ bot.; a. v. fr., v. לָקִישׁ I; a. other Amoraim; v. Fr. M’bo p. 127ᵃ–130ᵃ', 'number': '—4)'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shimei, '}, {'definition': ' son of Gera the Benjamite, who insulted David on his flight. Ber. 8ᵃ. Koh. R. to VII, 15. Meg. 12ᵇ; a. e.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' brother of Onias, the founder of the Temple of Onias (v. חוֹנְיוּ). Men. 109ᵇ', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Shemaiah, colleague of Abṭalion (v. אַבְטַלְיוֹן). Pes. 66ᵃ. Ab. I, 10. Yoma 71ᵇ. Gitt. 57ᵇ; a. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Samson. Sot. I, 8 ש׳ הלך וכ׳ S. followed his eyes, therefore they put his eyes out. B. Bath. 91ᵃ, v. הַצְּלֶלְפּוֹנִי; a. fr.—Naz. I, 2 הריני כש׳ וכ׳ if one says, I will be like S., like Manoah’s son &c. Ib., a. fr. נזיר ש׳, v. נָזִיר. Ib. מה בין … לנזיר ש׳ what is the difference between a Nazarite for life and a Nazarite like S.? Y. ib. 51ᵇ היידין אינון כינויי ש׳ what are the substitutes for Shimshon (in a Nazarite vow)? שמשוך שמשור שמשוץ shimshokh, shimshor, shimshots'}]

[{'definition': ' (Ezra IV, 8, a. e.) pr. n. m. Shimshai, a scribe of the Samaritan colony; (in legend) a scribe at the court of Ahasuerus. Targ. II Esth. VI, 1.—Meg. 15ᵇ sq. (ref. to Esth. VI, 2) מלמד שש׳ מוחק וכ׳ this intimates that Sh. had erased (the record in favor of Mordecai), and Gabriel wrote it over. Yalk. Esth. 1045 המן … הוא ש׳ הסופר כלומר ש׳ בנו וכ׳ Haman the wicked, that is Sh. the scribe, that is to say, Sh. the son of Haman; Esth. R. introd.; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. שִׁשְׁעָה'}]
[{'definition': ' pr. n. m., v. סְעוֹרִים'}]
[{'definition': ', בֵּי שָׁ׳ the family of Shafekala (vinegar dealer). Kidd. 71ᵇ Ar. (ed. בי בר שפי חלא, v. שְׁפֵי II).'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Saraph. B. Bath. 91ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': 'Sharshum. B. Bath. 32ᵇ רבה בר ש׳ Ms. M. (ed. רבא; Ms. H. שרשו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) Sheshach, surname of Babylonia (supposed permutation of בבל by Atbash, v. א"ת). Num. R. s. 1821, v. א"ת. Meg. 6ᵃ, v. רַקַּת.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' בר ש׳ pr. n. m. Bar Sheshach, a Persian officer. Ab. Zar. 65ᵃ Ms. M. (ed. שֵׁישַׁךְ).', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Shishʿah. Y. Meg. I, 71ᶜ bot. (Fr. M’bo, p. 130ᵃ; ed. Krot. שע׳, oth. ed. ישע׳).—Y. Sabb. XIX, 16ᵈ bot., v. שִׁישְׁנָא.'}]
[{'definition': 'Shesheth, name of a renowned Babylonian Amora. Y. Yeb. II, 3ᶜ bot.; ib. III, 4ᵈ bot. Ber. 12ᵇ top. Ib. 16ᵃ. Ib. 58ᵃ רב ש׳ סגי וכ׳ R. Sh. was blind; a. v. fr.'}]

[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Seth, son of Adam. Num. R. s. 1412 he called him שת שממנו הושתת העולם Seth (foundation), because with him the world’s foundation was laid. Cant. R. to VIII, 9; a. e.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ben Tagla. Koh. R. to XII, 12 ספר בן ת׳ the Book of B. T. (an apocryphal book); v. לַעֲנָה I.'}]

[{'definition': 'Taddai (Thaddaeus). Y. Kil. I, 27ᵇ לעזר בן ת׳; Y. Sabb. III, 5ᵈ bot. Mekh. B’shall., Shir., s. 1 אליעזר בן ת׳; Tanḥ. B’shall. 11 אלעזר בן תדיי׳, read: תַּדַּיי; Yalk. Ex. 242 אליעזר בן עזריה (corr. acc.); Sabb. 123ᵃ.—Ib. 38ᵇ ר׳ ת׳.'}]

[{'definition': 'Todah (an adaptation of תַּדַּאי, Thaddæus, for the sake of paronomasia), one of the disciples of Jesus. Snh. 43ᵃ (missing in later editions) חמשה … ות׳ Jesus had five disciples; Matthew, … and T. Ib. אתיוה לת׳ אמר ת׳ יהרג וכ׳ they brought up T., and he said, shall T. be put to death? is it not written (Ps. C, 1), a song of T.? Said they to him אין ת׳ יהרג וכ׳ yes, T. shall be slain, for it is written (Ps. L, 23), he who sacrifices T. honoreth me.'}]

[{'definition': 'Todos (abbrev. of Theodoros), '}, {'definition': ' T. of Rome. Tosef. Bets. II, 15; Bets. 23ᵃ; Pes. 53ᵃ; Ber. 19ᵃ; a. e.', 'number': '1)'}, {'definition': ' T. the physician. Bekh. IV, 4. Tosef. Ohol. IV, 2 תִּיאוֹדוֹרוֹס הרופא.', 'number': '—2)'}]
[{'definition': 'Tuṭay, a Tanna. Kidd. 16ᵇ'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar-Tuṭani, an Amora. Sabb. 71ᵃ (Ms. M. תָּאטוּנִי); Ker. 4ᵇ תאוטני; ib. 12ᵇ תוטיני.'}]

[{'definition': ' (Johanan) ben Torta, a Tannai. Y. Taan. IV, 68ᵈ bot.; Lam. R. to II, 2. Num. R. s. 79; Tosef. Men. XIII, 22. Pesik. R. s. 14 (describing the origin of the name) אמר ומה אם פרה … מיד בא ונתגייר … יוחנן בן ת׳ he said, if a cow that has no speech and no mind recognized her Creator, should I whom my Maker has created in his image … not go and acknowledge my Creator? He went and became a Jew, and studied and grew efficient in the Law, and they named him Johanan ben T. (son of a cow); and to this day our teachers quote Hălakhah in his name.'}]

[{'definition': 'Taḥlifa, name of several Amoraim. Y. Ber. I, 2ᵈ bot. (ed. Krot. תחליפתא, corr. acc.). Y. Peah IV, end, 18ᶜ תַּחְלִיפָה. Keth. 8ᵃ; a. fr.—Y. Taan. II, beg. 65ᵃ ת׳ קיסריא T. of Cæsaræa; (Bab. ib. 15ᵇ אבא דמין קסרי). Y. R. Hash. IV, 59ᶜ bot. Y. Sot. V, end, 20ᵈ; (B. Bath. 15ᵇ אבא בר שמואל). Y. Ned. I, 36ᵈ bot.; a. e.—V. Fr. M’bo, p. 130ᵃ sq.'}]
[{'definition': 'Tima, an Amora. Y. Snh. IV, 22ᵇ ת׳ בר פפייס.'}]
[{'definition': ' (b. h.) pr. n. m. Talmai, one of the giants (Anakim). Yoma 13ᵃ; Sot. 34ᵇ, a. e., v. תֶּלֶם, a. תַּלְבּוּשׁ.'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar T’lamion (Bartholomew). Lev. R. s. 6; Pesik. R. s. 22; Yalk. Zech. 571; Yalk. Lev. 471 בר תמליון.—V. תְּמַלְיוֹן.'}]
[{'definition': ' (Θαλάσσιος) Talassios, a Roman officer. Y. Meg. III, 74ᵃ bot. Mus. (ed. תלתכים, corr. acc.), in Hebrew disguise תרשיש; v. אֶבְדּוֹקוֹס.'}]
[{'definition': ' (preced.) Tammuza, Tammuz, name of a deity (corresp. to Adonis of the Greeks). Targ. Ez. VIII, 14.'}]
[{'definition': 'Ben T’malyon. Meïl. 17ᵇ; Yalk. Lev. 537.—V. תְּלַמְיוֹן.'}]

[{'definition': ' Targ. Cant. II, 12.—Lev. R. s. 12; a. e.—Pl. תְּמָרַיָּא, תַּמְרִין, תַּמְרֵי, תּוּמְ׳. Targ. II Chr. XXXI, 5. Targ. Y. Deut. VIII, 8.—Ber. 38ᵃ דובשא דת׳ date-honey. [Ib. האי תמרי של תרומה, read with Ms. M. תמרים של תרומה.] Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40ᵈ גרעינין דתו׳ date-stones. Sabb. 110ᵇ ת׳ פרסייתא (fem.) Persian dates; a. fr.—בר תמרי pr. n. m. Bar-Tamré. Ḥull. 110ᵃ רמי בר ת׳ וכ׳ Rami bar Tamré, also called Bar-Diḳḳulé (cmp. דִּיקּוּלָא).—Cant. R. to VII, 9 אבון בר ת׳ quot. in Levy Talm. Dict. (ed. חסדי).'}]

[{'definition': 'Tanḥum, name of several Amoraim. Sabb. 30ᵃ.—Y. Yeb. X, 11ᵇ. Y. Taan. I, 63ᵈ top ת׳ אדרעייא; Y. Ber. V, 9ᵇ top ת׳ (a. תנחומא).—Ib. IV, 7ᵈ bot. ת׳ בר איסכולסטיקא; a. others (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 130ᵇ, sq.).—Tanḥ. Ḥuck. 4 ת׳ בר חנילאי (v. Bub. introd. to Tanḥ. p. 62).'}]

[{'definition': ' (v. preced.) pr. n. m. Tanḥuma, name of one or several Amoraim. Y. Ber. I, 2ᵇ bot. Y. Shek. VI, 49ᵈ bot.; a. e. (v. Fr. M’bo, p. 131ᵃ, sq.).—Gen. R. s. 1; a. fr. (v. Buber introd. to Tanḥ., p. 62).—Midrash Tanḥuma, v. מִדְרָשׁ.'}]
[{'definition': 'Tafday, an Amora. Gen. R. s. 8 ed. Theodor (Var. תַּפְרַאי, תַּפְרַיי). Gen. R. s. 14 (Var. תפר׳; ed. Wil. תפדויי).'}]
[{'definition': 'Bar Tafkòan. Y. Keth. X, end, 34ᵃ'}]

[{'definition': 'Be-Tharbu, name of a settlement near Pumb’ditha, and of a family. Yoma 77ᵇ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6). B. Kam. 23ᵇ עיזי דבי ת׳ וכ׳ (Ms. H. תרכו) the goats of Be-T. did damage &c.'}]
[{'definition': ' (v. preced.) T’radah, name of a Persian king (nickname of Ahasuerus?). Esth. R. to I, 3, v. פְּרוּסָה.'}]
[{'definition': 'T’radyon. Ab. Zar. 18ᵃ חנינא בן ת׳ (חנניה); a. fr.'}]
